alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nolan and southwestern Fisher Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wastella, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roscoe, Wastella, Gannon, I-20 Near The Nolan- Mitchell County Line and Us-84 Near The Nolan-Fisher County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 240. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
